title: load scaled image refferenced in MyImageView on demand
message:
load scaled image refferenced in MyImageView on demand

ImageViews hold onto the originally decoded Bitmap from resources to
be able to resize the image when needed. But since the main use case
for MyImageView is to load a static sized scaled down version of an
oversized original, much memory is wasted.

To reduce memory usage and improve performance several changes have
been made. Only the resource id of the image is stored. It can be set
in the constructor using AttributeSet or by calling setResId(int). In
onMeasure() only the image demensions are decoded. Finally, in onDraw()
the scaled image is decoded in a background thread.

title: make the image cache classes non-static for better reuse

make the image cache classes non-static for better reuse

Having the resized image classes (BoardButtonCache, PlaceButtonCache)
static prevented easy reuse in other classes, by forcing any new
layout view that needed resized images to create its own class.

Instead, create PieceImgCache with functions to return resized images.
Each layout view (BoardLayout, PlaceLayout) creates an instance of

add notification service and settings activity

GenesisNotifier is a service that checks for new games, msgs or
games which you need to move. It works with GenesisAlarm which
recieves alarm timeouts and starts GenesisNotifier. Henceforth,
the service is only on for short intervals. The simplified algorithm is:

		send notifications if any

title: update register and login password protocol
message:
update register and login password protocol

The password is send to the server as a SHA-1 hash instead of plain-text.

	SHA1(SHA1(password))

The login protocol has changed to use a very simple zero-knowledge proof.
The server sends a random string on a new connection. The client takes the
double hashed password and appends the random string and hashes it again.
The hash is send to the server, which also does the same. If the hashes
match the client is authenticated.

	SHA1(HashedPassword + RandomString)

title: make SocketClient static so app only uses one connection
message:
make SocketClient static so app only uses one connection

Except for the constructor, all SocketClient functions are now
static, allowing for a single socket to be used for all connections.

This single socket is also managed using a "reference counter" class
called NetActive. On each Activity's onResume the count is incremented;
and when onPause is called the count is decremented. If the count is
zero, then NetDisconnect is called in a sepparate thread to close the
connection. It waits ~2sec and checks if the count is still zero to
finally close the connection.

This allows the app to use a single connection that will auto close
when the app is not visible or not needing a net connection.
